locations.name: The Shedd Institue
locations.details: The John G. Shedd Institute for the Arts, or The Shedd Institute, is a performing arts company, cultural arts center, and community music school in Eugene, Oregon, United States.

locations.name: W.O.W. Hall
locations.details: The W.O.W. Hall is a performing arts venue in Eugene, Oregon, United States. It was formerly a Woodmen of the World lodge. The W.O.W. Hall was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1996.

locations.details: Parking for the hult center.

locations.name: Heritage Dry Goods
locations.details: Only the very driest items from your history can be found here.

locations.name: Pewter Rabbit
locations.details: Eugene's on-trend antique shop.

locations.name: The New Zone Gallery
locations.details: The New Zone Gallery hosts the annual non-juried “Zone 4 All” March 4 – March 25th. The show is open to all artists with any 2D or 3D work.  Music for the evening will be provided by duo Sonic Pilgrim.

locations.name: Shadowfox
locations.details: “Intrinsic Motion”  is a performance exploring the visceral experience of music, dance, and art. Professional ballet dancer Amanda Coleman debuts original choreography set to music by Jason Pancoast.

locations.name: Mecca
locations.details: Reuse artist Kat Witt turns waste into wonderful in an exhibition that challenges us to think differently about unwanted materials.  This show is a collaboration of color, creative design, and wonder.  Pieces include multimedia works incorporating 3D and lighting effects, fashion design and textiles, and acrylic oil color paper mache printmaking.  All pieces are made by hand with items that were at hand.

locations.name: The Lincoln Gallery
locations.details: Artists from the OSLP Arts & Culture Program and Tropical Contemporary have come together for this exciting exhibition of contemporary art called “Fritos and Cats.” Both artist groups have been working together on collaborative art projects during the month of February.

locations.name: Raven Frameworks
locations.details: Raven Frameworks showcases “Small Pleasures,” featuring drawings, watercolors and mosaic art by Anne Korn and Terry Way. This exhibit is a collection of old and new work, each measuring under 15 X 15 inches.
